page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The{River Trent}runs through this area separating the{Meadows}to the north of the river, from the village of{Wilford}and the town of{West {Bridgford}to the south.Three bridges take traffic across the river. In the{Meadows,}which is part of the city of{Nottingham,}many of the Victorian houses have been demolished and new houses built instead. There is an industrial estate too. {Wilford}is a growing village community with small areas of new houses.Leisure organisations flourish, which gives the village a lively social network. {West Bridgford}has grown over the last hundred years from a small village to a thriving,busy town of about 27,000 inhabitants. Within the town is County Hall and the{Rushcliffe {Civic Centre.}
